__e: I work very closely with Harold every day. As a character witness, I have more to say about his character. [CELL PHONE rings]
Harold and I are on all night.
I didn't want to know about Mike and the bar, and just now, you asked me if I wanted to know about Mike and Harold, and again, I didn't want to know.
Harold said you didn't seem so happy the other day.
Where were you when Harold lost his job a year ago, huh?
Harold has something he needs to say.
Harold's in the garden but he'll be here in a moment.
I wonder if Harold's still in jail.
But I do know that Harold's my friend.
But for Harold, it's a matter of life and death.
He says, "Harold doesn't talk to me, anymore."
And I don't think Harold's coming in at all, so...
Look, Harold may not like you, but he respects you, and he's all alone.
Harold, I told you I didn't wanna go into it right now.
Harold, I cannot do it without you.
Harold, I don't need to tell you what's at stake here.
